name: SERP Audio Downloader
tagline: Rip lossless audio, podcasts, and music from 1,000+ providers in one click.
description:
SERP Audio Downloader is the dedicated track and episode capture engine for people who need pristine masters from anywhere online. It fingerprints 1,000+ streaming, social, course, and podcast hosts, pulls the highest-quality rendition they expose—FLAC, WAV, 320kbps MP3, or AAC—and leaves you with clean, chapter-aware files ready for editing or archive.

The extension keeps a real-time manifest of supported providers, handles segmented HLS/DASH audio just as easily as progressive downloads, and merges multi-part shows without leaving stray gaps or channel drift. Teams can batch entire seasons, auto-normalise loudness to LKFS targets, and auto-fill ID3 artwork and metadata so the files are broadcast-ready the moment they land in storage.

faqs.question: Which platforms does SERP Audio Downloader support?
faqs.answer: The manifest covers 1,000+ verified sources spanning DSPs, podcast hosts, livestreamers, membership communities, and course platforms. New providers ship weekly without waiting on store approvals.

faqs.question: Can it download entire podcast seasons or playlists?
faqs.answer: Yes. Queue full seasons, private RSS feeds, or branded playlists and the extension will parallelise downloads while respecting provider rate limits.

faqs.question: Does audio stay lossless?
faqs.answer: When providers expose lossless FLAC or WAV renditions, SERP Audio Downloader grabs them. Otherwise it selects the highest bitrate available and never transcodes unless you apply a post-processing recipe.

faqs.question: How are metadata and artwork handled?
faqs.answer: ID3v2 tags, embedded artwork, chapters, and cue sheets are pulled directly from the source manifest. You can customise templates so recurring fields—like show, season, or campaign IDs—stay consistent.

faqs.question: Can teams collaborate?
faqs.answer: Teams can share recipe presets, monitor download progress on a central dashboard, and export audit logs so compliance reviews are simple.

faqs.question: What about private or authenticated content?
faqs.answer: Bring your own cookies or headers, store them securely per provider, and SERP Audio Downloader reuses the session—if you can play the audio, you can save it.

permission_justifications.justification: Writes finished audio files, cue sheets, transcripts, and metadata bundles directly to your downloads folder with resume support for long batches.
Caches provider manifests, recipe presets, audio fingerprints, and queued jobs locally so capture workflows persist across sessions.
Injects SERP Audio Downloader controls into the tab you are viewing and inspects media descriptors only for that context.
Tracks when you switch episodes or open playlists in new tabs so queued downloads map to the correct sources.
Extracts manifests, signed URLs, and segmented audio streams from protected players without sending data to external services.
Rewrites streaming requests when providers obfuscate segment paths or token refreshers, ensuring gapless audio downloads.
Limits elevated access to whitelisted provider domains and the manifest update endpoint required for extractor updates.
